teknoluv wrote: ↑Yes, it's understandable since Tang and Shum are like brother and sister FOR SO MANY YEARS. But then WHY did Cheung have to even care about Shum AFTER they had divorced?? Moreover, Shum never wanted Cheung to play a good part in her daughter's life until more recent years.

I even heard Adam's current wife is pretty tempermental too.

I've actually met and got close to Adam Cheng in Toronto back in November 1988. Back then, my dad was helping the folks at Profekta (TVB's exclusive distributor in Toronto at the time) and his restaurant sponsored an anniversary show for them while TVB sends some of their actors to do a show at Seneca College Auditorium. I was only 7 years old at the time but even then, I did not have a good impression of him. I keep getting bad vibes from him. Dude gave me the cuteye after I walked off and asked a waitress for her number. All the other TVB actors and executives chuckled at me and thought it was cute. Only Adam was giving me this angry stare. I was just like any other typical CBC so I couldn't care less what Adam was thinking at the time.

I've even heard that Adam Cheng kept bugging my dad about giving him a 5 star hotel which my dad refused cuz it'd be unfair for the other actors. Thought it was pretty annoying to hear he'd make that kinda request. Considering the fact that my grandfather was one of the first people who produced his albums in Adam's early years, I don't think Adam has the right to even make that request. My impression of him just gone down the drain when I found out about it. And to think I used to idolize him in my toddler years.

(On an added note, Bennett Pang Kin-San was a pretty cool guy. I remember laughing and singing along to his "strip off your clothes and shoes" song. And he doodled a picture of himself. I'm sure Bennett Pang is great with kids. He handled me pretty well.)
